steps.output: Vietnam has borders with China, Laos and Cambodia

steps.input: Vietnam has borders with China, Laos and Cambodia

output.title: Geography | Embassy of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in the United States
output.snippet: It has a long land border of 4,550 km, bordering China to the North, Laos and Cambodia to the West, and the Eastern Sea (South China Sea) of Pacific Ocean to the East. On the map, Viet Nam is an S-shaped strip of land, stretching from 23°23’ to 8°27’ North latitude.
output.content: It has a long land border of 4,550 km, bordering China to the North, Laos and Cambodia to the West, and the Eastern Sea (South China Sea) of Pacific Ocean to the East. On the map, Viet Nam is an S-shaped strip of land, stretching from 23°23’ to 8°27’ North latitude.

output.title: Vietnam neighboring countries: Sharing land and maritime borders – VinWonders
output.snippet: To the north of Vietnam is China, to the west is Laos, and to the southwest is Cambodia. To the east, Vietnam is surrounded by the East Sea (also known as the South China Sea) of the Pacific Ocean.
output.content: To the north of Vietnam is China, to the west is Laos, and to the southwest is Cambodia. To the east, Vietnam is surrounded by the East Sea (also known as the South China Sea) of the Pacific Ocean.

output.title: Laos–Vietnam border - Wikipedia
output.snippet: The Laos–Vietnam border is the international border between the territory of Laos and Vietnam. The border is 2,161 km (1,343 mi) in length and runs from the tripoint with China in the north to tripoint with Cambodia in the south.
output.content: The Laos–Vietnam border is the international border between the territory of Laos and Vietnam. The border is 2,161 km (1,343 mi) in length and runs from the tripoint with China in the north to tripoint with Cambodia in the south.

output.title: Which Countries Border Vietnam?
output.snippet: Vietnam is located on the Indochinese Peninsula and has an area of about 127,888.9 square miles. The country shares borders with three countries: Cambodia (southwest), China (north), and Laos (northwest).
output.content: Vietnam is located on the Indochinese Peninsula and has an area of about 127,888.9 square miles. The country shares borders with three countries: Cambodia (southwest), China (north), and Laos (northwest).

steps.output: Ao dai is the national costume of Vietnam

steps.input: Ao dai is the national costume of Vietnam

output.title: Ao Dai - Necessary Knowledge about Vietnamese National Costume
output.snippet: The ao dai Raglan is considered the most complete version of the modern ao dai. It was created by Tailor Dung by attaching the sleeves at a 45-degree angle to the neckline, allowing for more flexibility. This design, which dates back to the end of the 70s, remains the Vietnamese national dress and is appreciated not only by the Vietnamese people, but also by fashion and culture lovers around the world.
output.content: The ao dai Raglan is considered the most complete version of the modern ao dai. output.title: Áo dài - Wikipedia
output.snippet: Vietnamese: [ʔaːw˧˦ zaːj˨˩] (North), [ʔaːw˦˥ jaːj˨˩] (South)) is a modernized Vietnamese national garment consisting of a long split tunic worn over silk trousers. It can serve as formalwear for both men and women. Áo translates as shirt and dài means "long".
output.content: Vietnamese: [ʔaːw˧˦ zaːj˨˩] (North), [ʔaːw˦˥ jaːj˨˩] (South)) is a modernized Vietnamese national garment consisting of a long split tunic worn over silk trousers. It can serve as formalwear for both men and women. Áo translates as shirt and dài means "long".

output.snippet: Thailand has a more compact shape, with a coastline along the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea. It has mountains in the north and west and a lowland plain in the center. Thailand does not have a direct border with Vietnam, as they are separated by Laos and Cambodia.

scores.evidence: Thailand - Wikipedia. It shares land borders with Myanmar to the west and northwest, Laos to the east and northeast, Cambodia to the southeast, and Malaysia to the south. Its maritime boundaries include the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea, as well as maritime borders with Vietnam, Indonesia, and India.
scores.evidence_en: Thailand - Wikipedia. It shares land borders with Myanmar to the west and northwest, Laos to the east and northeast, Cambodia to the southeast, and Malaysia to the south. Its maritime boundaries include the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea, as well as maritime borders with Vietnam, Indonesia, and India.

scores.evidence: Map of Thailand and Vietnam. Thailand has a more compact shape, with a coastline along the Gulf of Thailand and the Andaman Sea. It has mountains in the north and west and a lowland plain in the center. Thailand does not have a direct border with Vietnam, as they are separated by Laos and Cambodia.

scores.evidence: Geography | Embassy of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in the United States. Between these two major deltas is a chain of small and narrow deltas along the Central coast from the Ma River basin in Thanh Hoa Province to Phan Thiet with the total area of 15,000 sq km. Viet Nam faces the Eastern Sea to the East and the Gulf of Thailand to the South and Southwest.
